  • Product Reviews & Recommendations

Ashia Aubourg

From the moment I started remixing ramen noodles into gourmet meals and spending hours watching cooking shows as a puny six-year-old, I knew I found a deep passion for food. While I realized — after taking on a two-year high school internship in an award-winning kitchen — that a…read more

published now

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

While many trends fade over time, the coquette aesthetic keeps gaining popularity. Interestingly, this bow-centric style actually originated in the 18th-century European Rococo period and the Victorian era, when lace, ribbons, and ruffles were commonly used in everything from fashion to home decor. Today, if you visit T.J. Maxx, you’ll find a variety of gems inspired by this romantic and adorable vibe.

Currently, a coquette-inspired soap pump is gaining a lot of attention on social media. This viral kitchen accessory is now available at T.J. Maxx, and shoppers can’t stop obsessing over it.

The soap dispenser is made of a ceramic-like material, and painted light pink with a delicate rose-colored bow on the front. It also features a gold-tone pump. While the exact price isn’t listed, similar items at T.J. Maxx usually range from $5 to $10.

One TikTok creator shared this bow-adorned find, and people quickly flooded the comments to express their love for it. “Ahh, I need one of these soap dispensers,” one commenter wrote, while another said, “I love the coquette girly finds.”

If you’re having trouble finding these coquette-inspired soap dispensers, don’t worry — there are plenty of similar options online. Urban Outfitters has a beautiful white one with a delicate pink ribbon for $18. 

At T.J. Maxx, you’ll spot plenty of coquette-inspired items. Right now, they have a bright cherry red platter with a bow design available online for $10 — perfect for hosting. They also offer a charming $17 white vase with a ribbon pattern, which is ideal for displaying your stunning bouquets.

With the coquette trend still going strong, if you’re looking for a cute and simple way to upgrade your kitchen, a trip to T.J. Maxx is a must to check out their collection of bow-inspired gems.

Buy: Bow Soap Dispenser, $18
